**Stories Structure:**

As a **[user]**, I want **[the feature]**, so that **[value]**

[user] : a **normal user** or a **group admin**. Both normal users and group admins can be **logged** or **non-logged**.

**Examples:**

1. As a user of a chat web app, I want to receive real-time notifications when I receive a new message, so that I can respond promptly without having to manually check the chat.
2. As a group_admin of a group, I want to manage user permissions in real-time, so that I can properly moderate the group.

**Spikes Structure:**

As **[developer]**, I want to  **[research** **about a specific topic/technology]**, so that **[goal]**

**Technical Task Structure:**

As **[developer]**, I want to **[implement something]**, so that **[technical improvement]**

**DoR:**

A story is ready when:

- it follows the previously defined structure.
- it receives a story point.
- it receives a priority level.
- it has a corresponding ID [Ci], i = C1  CN
- its acceptance tests are written in a structured format and cover key [user] interactions.

A **techinical task** is ready when:

- its acceptance tests are written in a structured format and cover key [developer] interactions, if possible and whenever it is necessary.

old.desc:
1. Password:
   1. Forgot: as a non logged user, i want the possibility to reset my password, so that i can recover my account.
   2. Modify: as a logged user, i want the possibility to change my password, so that my account remains safe.
2. Username: as a logged user, i want the possibility to change my username, so that i can personalize my profile and update my identity if needed.
3. Bio: as a logged user, i want to write a short introduction about myself, so that anyone can know me.
4. User Icon: as a logged user, i want to change my icon, so that i can choose whichever image i want.
5. Account Deletion: as a logged user, i want the possibility to delete my account, so that i can cancel my subscription any time.

###

**Verify that:**

- A non-logged user can access a **"Forgot Password"** option on the login page.
- The system sends an **email with a reset link** to the users registered email.
- The user can successfully **reset their password** by following the link and creating a new one.
- A logged-in user can access a **"Change Password"** option in their account settings.
- The user is prompted to **enter their current password** and then provide a **new password**.
- The system checks that the new password meets the required **security standards** (e.g., minimum length, includes numbers/characters).
- The new password is applied immediately for future logins.
- A logged-in user can access an **"Account Deletion"** option in account settings.
- The user is prompted with a **confirmation message** to confirm they wish to delete their account.
- If confirmed, the users account is **permanently deleted** along with their associated data (if applicable).

old.desc:
1. As a non registered user, i want to sign up, so that i can start using the  web app.
2. As a non logged user, i want to log in, so that i can start using the web app.
3. As a logged user, at some point, i want to log out, so that no one can access my data without permission.



**Verify that:**

- A non-registered user can access a **"Sign Up"** option on the login page.
- The user is presented with a **confirmation email** to verify their account.
- Upon successful verification, the user can **log in** using the credentials they just created.
- The system prevents the creation of accounts with **already registered email addresses** or **duplicate usernames**.
- A non-logged user can access the **"Log In"** page.
- The user can enter their **email address/username** and **password** to log in.
- The system validates the credentials and allows the user to **access the web app** if the information is correct.
- If the login fails (wrong credentials), an appropriate **error message** is displayed.
- A logged-in user can access a **"Log Out"** option in the app's settings or user menu and return on the login page.
- The system **clears session data** and **removes any stored credentials**.

2. As a non logged user, i want to log in, so that i can start using the web app.
3. As a logged user, at some point, i want to log out, so that no one can access my data without permission.

card.desc:
- Automated unit tests are written and all tests are green.
- Autodoc has been generated at least in english language (italian is not mandatory)
- Automated acceptance tests have been implemented, inspired by the "confirmation" section of the various stories, using Selenium; all have passed successfully.
- It has passed static analysis tests without errors, aimed at verifying the code's compliance with programming standards (PMD).
- When merging the branch related to the story, the code must first be reviewed by another team member and approved
- Technical tasks are considered "completed" (done) when the developer feels that he has achieved a sufficient theoretical and practical learning level to apply such technical knowledge in the project's implementation. In concrete and practical terms.
card.name: Definition of Done

old.desc:
As a logged user, I want to start a chat so that I can communicate with my friends.

**Verify that:**

- The logged-in user can **start a new chat** from the chat interface.
- The user can choose to start a **one-on-one chat** or **group chat** (if applicable).
- To start a **one-on-one chat**, the user can search for their **friend** by username, email, or other available search criteria.
- The user can select a friend from the search results, and a **new chat window** opens, allowing them to send messages immediately.
- For **group chats**, the user can select multiple friends from their friend list or search for friends by name or username.
- The user can **name the group chat** (optional) and **choose a group avatar** (optional).
- After starting the chat, the user can immediately send text messages, files, and media within the chat window.
- The newly created chat appears in the users **chat history** for easy access.
- The system ensures that only **active users** can be added to the chat.
- The chat is displayed with the **correct list of participants**, and the user can see whether they are chatting with one person or a group.
- The feature works consistently across **desktop and mobile** versions.
- The user can easily **resume a previous conversation** by selecting it from the chat history.

card.desc: As a logged user, I want to start a chat so that I can communicate with my friends.

old.desc:
1. Password:
   1. Forgot: as a non logged user, i want the possibility to reset my password, so that i can recover my account.
   2. Modify: as a logged user, i want the possibility to change my password, so that my account remains safe.
2. Username: as a logged user, i want the possibility to change my username, so that i can personalize my profile and update my identity if needed.
3. Bio: as a logged user, i want to write a short introduction about myself, so that anyone can know me.
4. User Icon: as a logged user, i want to change my icon, so that i can choose whichever image i want.
5. Account Deletion: as a logged user, i want the possibility to delete my account, so that i can cancel my subscription any time.



### **Acceptance Test 1: Password Reset (Forgot)**

**Verify that:**

- A non-logged user can access a **"Forgot Password"** option on the login page.
- The system sends an **email with a reset link** to the users registered email.
- The user can successfully **reset their password** by following the link and creating a new one.

- A logged-in user can access a **"Change Password"** option in their account settings.
- The user is prompted to **enter their current password** and then provide a **new password**.
- The system checks that the new password meets the required **security standards** (e.g., minimum length, includes numbers/characters).
- The new password is applied immediately for future logins.
- A logged-in user can access an **"Account Deletion"** option in account settings.
- The user is prompted with a **confirmation message** to confirm they wish to delete their account.
- If confirmed, the users account is **permanently deleted** along with their associated data (if applicable).

old.desc: As a logged user, I want to start a chat so that I can communicate with my friends.

card.desc:
As a logged user, I want to start a chat so that I can communicate with my friends.

**Verify that:**

- The logged-in user can **start a new chat** from the chat interface.
- The user can choose to start a **one-on-one chat** or **group chat** (if applicable).
- To start a **one-on-one chat**, the user can search for their **friend** by username, email, or other available search criteria.
- The user can select a friend from the search results, and a **new chat window** opens, allowing them to send messages immediately.
- For **group chats**, the user can select multiple friends from their friend list or search for friends by name or username.
- The user can **name the group chat** (optional) and **choose a group avatar** (optional).
- After starting the chat, the user can immediately send text messages, files, and media within the chat window.
- The newly created chat appears in the users **chat history** for easy access.
- The system ensures that only **active users** can be added to the chat.
- The chat is displayed with the **correct list of participants**, and the user can see whether they are chatting with one person or a group.
- The feature works consistently across **desktop and mobile** versions.
- The user can easily **resume a previous conversation** by selecting it from the chat history.
card.name: [3] Direct Chat

checkItem.name: The user can select a friend from the search results, the chat window opens, allowing them to send messages.

1. As a non registered user, i want to sign up, so that i can start using the  web app.
2. As a non logged user, i want to log in, so that i can start using the web app.
3. As a logged user, at some point, i want to log out, so that no one can access my data without permission.

Verify that:

### **Acceptance Test 1: Sign Up (Non-Registered User)**

**Verify that:**

- A non-registered user can access a **"Sign Up"** option on the login page.
- The user is presented with a **confirmation email** to verify their account.
- Upon successful verification, the user can **log in** using the credentials they just created.
- The system prevents the creation of accounts with **already registered email addresses** or **duplicate usernames**.

- A non-logged user can access the **"Log In"** page.
- The user can enter their **email address/username** and **password** to log in.
- The system validates the credentials and allows the user to **access the web app** if the information is correct.
- If the login fails (wrong credentials), an appropriate **error message** is displayed.

- A logged-in user can access a **"Log Out"** option in the app's settings or user menu and return on the login page.
- The system **clears session data** and **removes any stored credentials**.

old.desc:
1. As a logged user, I want to create a group chat so that I can communicate with multiple friends at once.
2. As a group admin user, I want to be able to assign the administrator role to one or more participants, so that I can share group management responsibilities.

**Verify that:**

- The logged-in user can create a **new group chat** from the chat interface.
- The user can **name the group**  and **add multiple participants** from their friend list or by entering usernames or emails.
- After creating the group, the user is automatically set as the **group admin**.
- The user can send messages, share files, and communicate with all group members.

- The **group admin** can assign the **administrator role** to one or more participants from the group settings or participant list.
- When assigning the admin role, a **clear indication** (e.g., "Admin" label) appears next to the name of the participant who has been granted admin rights.
- The **admin role can be revoked** at any time by the current admin.
- Only the **group admin** has the ability to assign or revoke admin roles; other participants cannot manage admin privileges.

- The system correctly **restricts unsupported file types** (e.g., `.exe`, `.apk`).

Verify that:

- The user can access a **"Search Friends"** feature from the chat interface or contacts list.
- The search function allows queries based on:
  - **Username**
  - **Email (if permitted by privacy settings)**
  - **Full name (if applicable)**
- If a matching friend is found, their **profile and status** (e.g., online/offline) are displayed.
- If no match is found, an appropriate **"No results found"** message is shown.
- The search results update dynamically as the user types (if live search is enabled).
- The user can **send a friend request or start a chat** directly from the search results.
- The search respects **privacy settings** (e.g., users who have restricted visibility do not appear in search).
- The feature works consistently across **desktop and mobile** versions.
- The system prevents searching for **blocked users** (if applicable).
- The search function handles typos or partial matches effectively (if fuzzy search is supported).

- The user can **pin a single message** in a chat.

- The pinned message persists across sessions (e.g., if the user logs out and back in, the pinned message is still displayed).
- The user can **unpin** the message manually, after which no message remains pinned.

old.desc:
As a logged-in user, I want to see a visual indicator (popup) on chat conversations that contain unread messages.



Verify that:

- A **visual indicator (popup)** appears on chat conversations that contain unread messages.
- The indicator disappears immediately after the user opens the conversation.
- The indicator persists across sessions (e.g., if the user logs out and back in, unread messages are still marked correctly).
- The popup does not appear for conversations that have been read.
- If multiple conversations contain unread messages, each conversation shows its own indicator.
- The indicator updates in real-time when new unread messages arrive.
- The indicator respects **user settings** (e.g., if notifications for unread messages are disabled, the popup does not appear).

card.desc: As a logged-in user, I want to see a visual indicator (popup) on chat conversations that contain unread messages.

old.desc:
**Stories Structure:**

As a **[user]**, I want **[the feature]**, so that **[value]**

[user] : a **normal user** or a **group admin**. Both normal users and group admins can be **logged** or **non-logged**.

**Examples:**

1. As a user of a chat web app, I want to receive real-time notifications when I receive a new message, so that I can respond promptly without having to manually check the chat.

**Low**: Does not impact the core user experience, minor functionality (e.g., minor UI improvements).

**Medium:** Partially impacts the user experience or workflow but does not prevent the completion of core operations (e.g., performance optimization, usability improvements, and notification management).

**High:**  An essential feature, an important functionality for the proper operation of the application (e.g., group creation, searches).

**Very High:**  A core area of the system (e.g., message system allowing users to communicate, user roles).

**Critical:** Completely blocks the application or prevents its use without any workaround (e.g., total inability to send or receive messages for all users, service unreachable).

**Medium:** Impatta parzialmente lesperienza utente o il flusso di lavoro, ma non impedisce il completamento delle operazioni principali (esempio: ottimizzazione delle prestazioni, miglioramenti dellusabilit e gestione delle notifiche).

**High:**  Impatta una funzionalit essenziale, feature importante per il corretto funzionamento dellapplicazione**(**esempio: creazione dei gruppi)

**Very high:**  Impatta gravemente unarea critica del sistema, riducendo lefficienza o bloccando alcuni utenti(esempio: alcuni utenti non riescono a ricevere o inviare messaggi, problemi di accesso allaccount)

**Critical:** Blocca completamente lapplicazione o ne impedisce lutilizzo senza soluzione alternativa (esempio: impossibilit totale di inviare o ricevere messaggi per tutti gli utenti, servizio irraggiungibile).

Come utente di una web app di chat, io voglio ricevere notifiche in tempo reale quando ricevo un nuovo messaggio, in modo che possa rispondere tempestivamente senza dover controllare manualmente la chat.
card.name: Definition of Ready

card.desc:
**Low**: Non impatta lesperienza utente principale, funzionalit minore( esempio: miglioramenti UI minori)

**Medium:** Impatta parzialmente lesperienza utente o il flusso di lavoro, ma non impedisce il completamento delle operazioni principali (esempio: ottimizzazione delle prestazioni, miglioramenti dellusabilit e gestione delle notifiche).

**High:**  Impatta una funzionalit essenziale, feature importante per il corretto funzionamento dellapplicazione**(**esempio: creazione dei gruppi)

**Very high:**  Impatta gravemente unarea critica del sistema, riducendo lefficienza o bloccando alcuni utenti(esempio: alcuni utenti non riescono a ricevere o inviare messaggi, problemi di accesso allaccount)

**Critical:** Blocca completamente lapplicazione o ne impedisce lutilizzo senza soluzione alternativa (esempio: impossibilit totale di inviare o ricevere messaggi per tutti gli utenti, servizio irraggiungibile).

card.name: Roles (Sprint I)

cards.desc:
**Stories Structure:**

As a **[user]**, I want **[the feature]**, so that **[value]**

[user] : a **normal user** or a **group admin**. Both normal users and group admins can be **logged** or **non-logged**.

**Examples:**

1. As a user of a chat web app, I want to receive real-time notifications when I receive a new message, so that I can respond promptly without having to manually check the chat.
2. As a group_admin of a group, I want to manage user permissions in real-time, so that I can properly moderate the group.

**Spikes Structure:**

As **[developer]**, I want to  **[research** **about a specific topic/technology]**, so that **[goal]**

**Technical Task Structure:**

As **[developer]**, I want to **[implement something]**, so that **[technical improvement]**

**DoR:**

A story is ready when:

- it follows the previously defined structure.
- it receives a story point.
- it receives a priority level.
- it has a corresponding ID [Ci], i = C1  CN

A **techinical task** is ready when:

- its acceptance tests are written in a structured format and cover key [developer] interactions, if possible and whenever it is necessary.
cards.name: Definition of Ready

cards.name: Roles (Sprint I)

cards.desc:
**Low**: Does not impact the core user experience, minor functionality (e.g., minor UI/UX improvements, unread messages pop-ups).

**Medium:** Partially impacts the user experience or workflow but does not prevent the completion of core operations (e.g., usability improvements, searches).

**High:** An essential feature, an important functionality for the proper operation of the application (e.g., group creation).

**Very High:** A core area of the system (e.g., message system allowing users to communicate, user roles).
cards.name: Priority Levels

cards.desc:
A **Story** is Done when:

- **Automated unit tests** are written and all tests are green.
- **Autodoc** must be generated in English (Italian not mandatory), and is required only for the core code, meaning all components implementing the applications core business logic and essential operations (like API).
- **Automated acceptance tests** have been implemented, inspired by the "confirmation" section of the various stories; all have passed successfully.
- It has passed **static analysis** tests without errors, aimed at verifying the code's compliance with programming standards (PMD).
- When merging the branch related to the story, the code must first be **reviewed** by another team member and approved.

**Technical tasks** are considered done when:

- The developer feels that he has achieved a **sufficient theoretical** and **practical learning level** to apply such technical knowledge in the project's implementation in concrete and practical terms. Where required, all autonomous unit tests are accepted.
- When merging the branch related to the story, the code must first be **reviewed** by another team member and approved.

**A spike** is done when :

- The developer has gained sufficient **confidence** and **understanding** of the subject required for the application and has created a document to **share** their knowledge.
cards.name: Definition of Done
